description: Rare bearish reversal pattern shaped like a diamond. Forms when price action widens then narrows, creating expanding then contracting volatility. Highly reliable when properly identified.
validationRules: Breakdown through lower support line confirms pattern
Volume typically high during formation, increases on breakdown
invalidationSignals: Forms in middle of downtrend (not a top)
commonMistakes: Misidentifying other patterns as diamonds - they're rare
Not measuring pattern height for target
Expecting perfect symmetry - close approximation is enough

tradeSetup.entry: Breakdown below lower support with volume confirmation
tradeSetup.stopLoss: Above the diamond's widest point or recent swing high
tradeSetup.target: Height of diamond measured from breakdown point

supportive: RSI showing bearish divergence throughout formation
